results.title: Worshiping in Hard Hats: Notre-Dame Offers First Mass Since Blaze
results.abstract: A small group celebrated their faith and a fragile cathedral, which remains closed amid rebuilding.

results.title: In Face-Off With Iran, Escalation May Depend on Who Prevails Inside Washington and Tehran
results.abstract: The attacks in the Gulf of Oman emboldens the hard-liners in Iran and the U.S., each able to argue their longtime adversary is itching for war.
results.byline: By DAVID E. SANGER and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK

results.title: Al-Bashir to Appear in Court to Face Graft Charges
results.abstract: An appearance by the former dictator Omar Hassan al-Bashir might relieve speculation over whether the junta is holding him or he has fled.

results.title: How Hong Kong’s Leader Made the Biggest Political Retreat by China Under Xi
results.abstract: Limited consultation within the Hong Kong government, and none with the public, led to an unexpected setback for local authorities and China’s government.

results.title: Carrie Lam, Hong Kong’s Leader, Retreats, but Her Critics Want More
results.abstract: The extradition bill has been suspended, but calls for new protests foreshadow more upheaval in Hong Kong and signal that Mrs. Lam’s troubles are not over.
